title: [K-12] Advanced Simulation Training for Central Venous Catheter Insertion

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Anatomy and Clinical Skills Theory
context.additional_context: Implementing mobile-based blended learning in a constrained technology environment. Simulation practices are structured as monthly face-to-face sessions.

learning_goals: After mobile module learning, over 90% of learners can explain the theoretical steps of central venous catheter insertion (anatomical identification, aseptic technique, complication management).
After simulation training, over 85% of learners achieve 80+ points on skill performance based on standardized checklist criteria.
At the end of training, over 80% of learners record 4+ points (on a 5-point scale) on self-efficacy surveys.

resources: Monthly in-person simulation kit for practical training
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
